alert.note: Alert for Garvin; Jefferson; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 4:45PM CDT until October 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Oklahoma, including the following counties, Carter, Cotton, Garvin, Grady, Jefferson, Murray and Stephens. Portions of northern Texas, including the following county, Clay. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Duncan, Pauls Valley, Walters, Waurika, Healdton, Comanche, Maysville, Bray, Ringling, Temple, Elmore City, Velma, Paoli, Randlett, Katie, Foster, Tatums, Hastings, Loco and Ratliff City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
